title: GA5 Question 8 Clarification
content: I need clarification on Question 8 of GA5. Should I use gpt-4o-mini which AI proxy supports, or gpt-3.5-turbo as mentioned in the question?
raw_content: I need clarification on Question 8 of GA5. Should I use gpt-4o-mini which AI proxy supports, or gpt-3.5-turbo as mentioned in the question?

title: GA5 Question 8 Clarification
content: You must use gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, even if the AI Proxy only supports gpt-4o-mini. Use the OpenAI API directly for this question. The assignment specifically requires this model for proper evaluation.
raw_content: You must use `gpt-3.5-turbo-0125`, even if the AI Proxy only supports `gpt-4o-mini`. Use the OpenAI API directly for this question. The assignment specifically requires this model for proper evaluation.

title: Token Counting for Cost Calculation
content: How do I count tokens accurately for the cost calculation part? Should I use the same tokenizer as the model?
raw_content: How do I count tokens accurately for the cost calculation part? Should I use the same tokenizer as the model?

title: Token Counting for Cost Calculation
content: Yes, use the tokenizer corresponding to the model you're using. For gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, you can use the tiktoken library with the 'cl100k_base' encoding. Count both input and output tokens for accurate cost calculation. Install with pip install tiktoken.
raw_content: Yes, use the tokenizer corresponding to the model you're using. For gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, you can use the tiktoken library with the 'cl100k_base' encoding. Count both input and output tokens for accurate cost calculation. Install with pip install tiktoken.

title: Installation Issues with OpenAI Package
content: I'm getting an error when trying to install the openai package. The error says 'Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement'. How can I fix this?
raw_content: I'm getting an error when trying to install the openai package. The error says 'Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement'. How can I fix this?

title: Installation Issues with OpenAI Package
content: Try upgrading pip first: pip install --upgrade pip. Then install the openai package: pip install openai==1.12.0. Make sure you're using a recent Python version (3.8 or higher). This should resolve the installation issues.
raw_content: Try upgrading pip first: pip install --upgrade pip. Then install the openai package: pip install openai==1.12.0. Make sure you're using a recent Python version (3.8 or higher). This should resolve the installation issues.

title: GA4 Data Sourcing Discussion Thread TDS Jan 2025
content: If a student scores 10/10 on GA4 as well as a bonus, how would it appear on the dashboard? Would it show as 11/10 or something else?
raw_content: If a student scores 10/10 on GA4 as well as a bonus, how would it appear on the dashboard? Would it show as 11/10 or something else?

title: GA4 Data Sourcing Discussion Thread TDS Jan 2025
content: Yes, if you get 10/10 plus bonus marks, the dashboard would show '110' (110%). The system displays bonus marks as percentages above 100. So a perfect score with bonus appears as 110 on the dashboard.
raw_content: Yes, if you get 10/10 plus bonus marks, the dashboard would show '110' (110%). The system displays bonus marks as percentages above 100. So a perfect score with bonus appears as 110 on the dashboard.

title: Docker vs Podman for TDS Course
content: I know Docker but have not used Podman before. Should I use Docker for this course or learn Podman?
raw_content: I know Docker but have not used Podman before. Should I use Docker for this course or learn Podman?

title: Docker vs Podman for TDS Course
content: We recommend using Podman for this course as it's what we'll be teaching. However, Docker is acceptable if you're already familiar with it. The concepts are very similar, but Podman has some security advantages and is rootless by default.
raw_content: We recommend using Podman for this course as it's what we'll be teaching. However, Docker is acceptable if you're already familiar with it. The concepts are very similar, but Podman has some security advantages and is rootless by default.
